pageContext.claim: “You look at Arizona, you don't even have to have -- as you know, they have a provision where they don't have to check signatures. You sign it, and you could have a totally different signature. It's okay. It won't be approved. They have the right to go seven days after the election for approval, so you're not even going to know who won the state of Nevada.”
pageContext.analysis: False. Both Arizona and Nevada verify signatures before counting mail ballots.
